title: Data Analyst
description: Financial Data Analyst Tina's Burritos is the leading CPG brand of frozen single serve burritos in America and is owned by Camino Real Foods, Inc. We bake up a million budget friendly burritos in our Los Angeles, CA factory daily and serve them to burrito lovers who appreciate great taste, convenience, and quick meals filled with important daily nutrients. All of our products are slow cooked in large kettles so the spices and flavors meld together for a flavor profile that is the industry leader, and then flash frozen for freshness. From Moms to Movie Stars, many customers write in and say they have been "addicted" to our burritos since 1984 when we first started making them. Others write in and say they started buying our products with food stamps because it was all they could afford, but now they buy Tina's Burritos with money in the bank. We are very proud to be able to produce a quality product that helps eliminate food insecurity in America and save our customers time and money that can be put towards advancing their own lives. You can find our products in the frozen aisle and deli section of your favorite grocery or convenience store nationwide. From our freezer to yours with love, for more information visit https://www.tinasburritos.com Please watch this short video to hear What Makes Tina's Burritos So Special in the words of our employees, managers, and CEO. Key Responsibilities 1. Financial, Planning & Analysis: Collect, organize, and analyze supply chain data from Internal and External sources. Assist with building financial models to drive insights into profitability Partner with departments to build the annual budget Develop and maintain KPIs for each department and track performance to forecast /goal Create updated forecast with risks and opportunities and provide variance analysis to budget Assist with the strategic planning process 2. Data Analytics: Develop and maintain key performance indicators (KPIs) to measure supply chain performance. (WOS Targets, OTIF, Forecast Accuracy…) Assist production with building inventory plan as a function of sales forecast and ensure Optimal stock levels are maintained to avoid out-of-stock or overstock situations. Create regular reports and dashboards to present insights and trends to management and team members. 3. Demand Forecasting: Utilize historical data, sales trends, and other relevant factors to forecast future demand for products to ensure we meet our customers’ expectations. Collaborate with sales, marketing, production, and purchasing teams to align forecasts with business strategies. 4. Retail Analytics: Gather and organize valuable opportunities from Nielsen and customer-specific sources. Present this information to the sales team, enabling them to offer customers well informed recommendations and make data-driven decisions. 5. Cross-functional Collaboration: Work closely with various departments, including production, purchasing, sales, finance, and IT, to gather data and align strategies. Be a thought leader on the ERP implementation project and help drive industry best practices Maintain the inputs in the ERP (BOM, User settings, Standards, etc.) and build reporting as needed Key Skills Degree in finance or accounting Excellent Microsoft Excel spreadsheet ability love for data and analytical reasoning to solve business problems Critical technical skills combined with solid accounting skills to execute various bookkeeping, analysis, forecasting, financial modeling, and budgeting Ability to communicate across departments and with the executive team

title: Performance Analyst
description: Disney Entertainment Content creates award-winning content across the portfolio of television brands and businesses, including ABC Entertainment, ABC News, Disney Branded Television, FX and FX Productions, Freeform, Nat Geo and Hulu Originals. A home to dynamic storytellers and talented creators, Disney Entertainment Television Content develops, produces and programs exceptional content of unparalleled scale and reach with more than 300 programs a year representing over 4,500 hours of programming across our linear networks, and streaming platforms Disney+, Hulu, and Star. The Disney Entertainment Research, Insights, and Analytics team sits within Disney Entertainment and consults with Senior Content, Strategy, and Marketing Leaders to deliver audience and content performance insights that inspire creative development and inform content strategy. The Analyst, Content Performance Analytics will join a team dedicated to delivering impactful data insights to inform a wide range of strategic decisions influencing the future of television at Disney Entertainment Television. Responsibilities and Duties of the Role: Conducting exploratory analysis across data sets to illuminate content viewing trends, and provide a deep and ongoing understanding of content performance and audience preferences Helping to design, build and automate new reports and dashboards as needed to support decision-making Using internal and external analytics tools, SQL, and scripting languages to access and analyze multivariate data Building strong partnerships and processes for ongoing collaboration with Analytics and Insights teams across The Walt Disney Company (Including Disney+ and Hulu) Performing administrative duties as needed Minimum Qualifications: The ideal candidate would have a passion for all forms of television and content Curiosity and passion for solving problems and answering challenging questions Outstanding communication skills – written, oral, presentation and storytelling A deep bench of knowledge and experience across at least one of the following areas: Fluency capturing and translating data and insights via visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, Looker, MicroStrategy) Expertise in data exploration and data science Experience working in “big data” environments (like Snowflake, Hadoop); Proficiency of SQL and an understanding of complex, large-scale relational databases, statistical programs and other tools (SAS, Python, R, etc.). Advanced knowledge of Nielsen, and other content and audience measurement services and tools (comScore, Tubular, Omniture, Gracenote) Advanced knowledge of Excel, including Macro creation and modification; Proficient with PowerPoint, Keynote Ability to be flexible, adapting to changing priorities and able to juggle multiple projects Relationship builder, one who excels in a collaborative environment Can self-start, work autonomously, and juggle multiple projects simultaneously; ability to prioritize competing tasks Strong organization and project management skills Superior attention to detail and accuracy Preferred Qualifications: Presentation graphics ability a plus (Keynote, iMovie) Required Education: BA/BS Degree in Economics, Statistics, Econometrics, Mathematics, Data Science, Computer Science, or equivalent/related degree is preferred The hiring range for this position in Burbank, CA is $68,200 to $93,800 per year based on a 40 hour work week. The amount of hours scheduled per week may vary based on business needs. The base pay actually offered will take into account internal equity and also may vary depending on the candidate’s geographic region, job-related knowledge, skills, and experience among other factors. A bonus and/or long-term incentive units may be provided as part of the compensation package, in addition to the full range of medical, financial, and/or other benefits, dependent on the level and position offered.

title: Senior Product Analyst
description: Under the direction of the Product Manager, the Product Analyst, Senior (Data/Digital) will assist with the design, implementation, and ongoing management of digital & data products and services to transform the experiences of patients, families, and staff combined. The Product Analyst, Senior (Data/Digital) will work closely with the various enterprise stakeholders of Keck Medicine of USC to articulate business requirements, build user stories, and identify the value proposition(s). The Product Analyst, Senior (Data/Digital) will partner with development teams (including assisting with testing, maintaining, and supporting the platform) and help oversee implementations that maximize digital & data solutions. The Product Analyst, Senior (Data/Digital) will conduct market research to understand industry problems and find innovative solutions, as well as aid in evangelizing digital & data product offerings to the business stakeholders to continually develop and expand the product roadmap. The Product Analyst, Senior (Data/Digital) will lead projects and work collaboratively with project teams to align on business and technical requirements. Essential Duties: Customer Service: Resolves customer questions and complaints, communicates with customers, handles services problems and tickets politely and efficiently, always available for customers, follows procedures, utilizes problem solving skills, maintains pleasant and professional image. Customers may include both internal department users, vendors, and peers within IS. Solution Design and Development: Analyzes events, documentation, requirements and needs to design and develop solutions to solve problems and/or meet organization’s needs. Responsible for designing, coding, and modifying websites, apps, and forms from layout to function and according to a client's specifications. Strives to create visually appealing sites that feature user-friendly design and clear navigation. Performance Improvement/Transformation/Innovation: Searches for and identifies alternative and/or innovative solutions to technical problems. Demonstrates an ongoing understanding of and actively participates in performance improvement activities, identifies, and proactively pursues business transformation, uses innovation to enhance/solve current system and business workflow problems. Acts as a subject matter expert for department functions in relationship to implementing and managing responsible systems. Technical Skills and Industry Knowledge: Working knowledge of multiple application systems/business functions with expertise in selected systems/functions. Knowledgeable of industry best practices, conventions, and regulations. Expertise in a limited number of applications, while becoming increasingly familiar with additional applications. Limited experience with integrating applications. Teamwork and Project Management: Leads small/medium projects. Facilitates team and cross-functional meetings. Uses planning skills to manage and complete projects on time and on budget. Reports & Analytics: Ability to generate both standard and ad hoc reports. Ability to design and assist in developing non-standard/custom reports as required. Training: Responsible for working with customer and/or vendors with training on new systems being implemented and rolled out for use in the departments. Responsible for training staff members on applicable systems/applications. Other Duties and On-Call: Ability to fulfill On-Call requirements and other duties as assigned. Required Qualifications: Bachelor's degree Bachelor’s degree or equivalent work experience. 4 years Experience in product/business analysis. Experience working with users to capture requirements and develop workflow diagrams that translate to application builds. Experience analyzing and recommending appropriate technical solutions to support the overall enterprise (including market research). Experience developing broader awareness of optimal use of solutions and maintain relationships with enterprise leaders (including but not limited to clinical, business, and research areas) to support data-driven decision making. Experience working with technical and functional teams within the applications development lifecycle. Experience leading the organization with projects and working closely with the Enterprise Project Management Office (EPMO) to develop benchmark measures, plans, and financial models to evaluate projects that impact the organization as it relates to products. Experience with Agile Project Management methodologies. Experience managing multiple priorities and operate in a fast paced, ambiguous, and complex environment with autonomy. Proficient in Microsoft Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Project, and Visio. Excellent critical thinking problem solving skills. Exceptional organization and time management skills. Exceptional communication skills, both written and verbal, with excellent presentation skills and the ability to adapt to differing audiences. Ability to develop and maintain good working relationships with coworkers, management, and vendors. Ability to self-initiate, work independently and in teams, self-manage and learn independently with discernment of when to escalate and seek guidance. Organized and detail-oriented. Preferred Qualifications: 2 years Healthcare IS experience preferred. Required Licenses/Certifications: Fire Life Safety Training (LA City) If no card upon hire, one must be obtained within 30 days of hire and maintained by renewal before expiration date. (Required within LA City only) The annual base salary range for this position is $110,240.00 - $181,896.00. When extending an offer of employment, the University of Southern California considers factors such as (but not limited to) the scope and responsibilities of the position, the candidate’s work experience, education/training, key skills, internal peer equity, federal, state, and local laws, contractual stipulations, grant funding, as well as external market and organizational considerations.

title: Content Marketer
description: Hulu is the leading premium streaming service offering live and on-demand TV and movies, with and without commercials, both in and outside the home. Operating at the intersection of entertainment and technology, Hulu has a unique opportunity to be the number one choice for TV. We captivate and connect viewers with the stories they love, and we’re looking for people who are passionate about redefining TV through innovation, unconventional thinking, and embracing fun. Join us and see what Hulugan life is all about. Summary Hulu’s Marketing Planning & Analysis (MP&A) team is seeking a Content Marketing Analytics Analyst who will be an outstanding addition. As an Analyst on the MP&A team, you will apply data and analytics to tackle our biggest challenges in Content Marketing. This will entail leading Content Marketing Analytics focused on providing insights and strategic recommendations in support of Content Marketing initiatives, and ensuring high business value in the analysis you provide. You will promote the use of data and analytics as a critical value driver and source of competitive advantage within Marketing and across our organization. The right person for this role has experience applying advanced analytics and insights to inform strategy, strong attention to detail, likes to solve problems, is intellectually curious and an innovator. If you are someone who is analytical and passionate about data-driven decision-making, then this is a great role for you. What you’ll do Analyze customer and content data to inform how Content Marketing efforts impact business goals, uncover growth and development opportunities for campaign planning, and guide strategy Produce advanced audience analyses using online and offline data and tools like SQL to support Content Marketing across Original and Licensed Marketing Conduct multivariate analysis related to acquisition, retention, and engagement to identify tactics that drive successful campaigns with an emphasis on understanding why a tactic worked to encourage reproducibility Anticipate analytical needs of the Content Marketing, design diagnostic solutions and collaborate with Data teams to deliver data products and insight Design, develop and maintain title level reports and dashboards for key metrics to illustrate progress against goals to support team activities and report to management on regular basis Develop analyses using various statistical methods (Regression, clustering, A/B testing etc.) while working collaboratively with business partners to identify high-impact opportunities related to campaign targeting What to bring 2-3 years of experience conducting data analysis and providing strategic recommendations to marketing initiatives Minimum Bachelor’s degree in a quantitative field (Statistics, Economics, Business etc.). Graduate degree preferred. Competent with data analysis and applying data to drive decision-making, specifically related to marketing effectiveness Experience collective, validating, and analyzing data. Must be able to manipulate data, develop visualizations, triangulate and summarize results Understanding of ETL concepts including data integration pipelines, staging tables, incremental loading, data quality and business logic Experience with the following tools/languages: SQL, Excel, PowerPoint, Tableau (or other BI/data viz tools) Experience manipulating and analyzing massive data sets Ability to tell a story with data both verbally and visually Just like the best ensemble casts of our favorite shows, Hulu embraces diversity and is an inclusive environment. We do not discriminate based upon race, religion, color, national origin, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, gender expression, transgender status, sexual stereotypes, age, status as a protected veteran, status as an individual with a disability, genetic information, or other applicable legally protected characteristics. We also consider qualified applicants with criminal histories, in accordance with applicable federal, state and local law. Hulu is committed to providing reasonable accommodations to applicants if needed during the interview process. We are proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. The hiring range for this position in CA is $93,400.00 to $125,200.00 per year. The base pay actually offered will take into account internal equity and also may vary depending on the candidate’s geographic region, job-related knowledge, skills, and experience among other factors. A bonus and/or long-term incentive units may be provided as part of the compensation package, in addition to the full range of medical, financial, and/or other benefits, dependent on the level and position offered.

title: Reporting Analyst
description: ***Remote and must live in California*** JOB DESCRIPTION Job Summary This Provider Data Reporting Analyst is part of the Provider Data Reporting and Analytics team at Molina. As a Provider Data Reporting Analyst, you will be responsible for compiling and disseminating data into actionable information for the department experts that support data integrity. There are nearly many ways our data can be utilized, but here are some examples of the work a Provider Data Reporting Analyst might perform: Design and build efficient SQL data control processes to assess data quality and clean up data by aligning it with a consistent structure and format. Manipulate, format, and analyze data (MS Excel) for downstream processes and reporting. Identify providers that meet special criteria for outreach. Audit provider data to ensure that claims pay correctly. Partner with technical and business teams to document, map, diagram, define, organize, and curate key data elements. KNOWLEDGE/SKILLS/ABILITIES Understanding of databases and SQL. Proficient in MS Excel and data analysis functions. Adept at working with internal stakeholders to research, develop, and document new standard reports or data processes. Ability to work independently to coordinate with stakeholders and drive an issue to resolution. Experienced in addressing data integrity gaps by working with business stakeholders and technical IT resources. JOB QUALIFICATIONS Required Education Bachelor's Degree or equivalent combination of education and experience Preferred Experience 3-5 years To all current Molina employees: If you are interested in applying for this position, please apply through the intranet job listing. Molina Healthcare offers a competitive benefits and compensation package. Molina Healthcare is an Equal Opportunity Employer (EOE) M/F/D/V. Pay Range: $44,936.59 - $97,362.61 / ANNUAL Actual compensation may vary from posting based on geographic location, work experience, education and/or skill level.
